title: Engineering Project Manager - Payments
description:
Mad Mobile is looking for an Engineering Project Manager for our Payments division to join our team in Seattle, WA. Come be part of an amazing team that continues to grow.

Mad Mobile works with the world’s leading retailers to deliver segment defining, highly integrated mobile solutions.   The Concierge offering is a mission critical application that provides in-store team members with clienteling, assisted selling, mobile point of sale and other key capabilities that deliver the future of retail.   Concierge integrates existing retail investments including CRM, POS, eCommerce, Order Management, ERP, Payment, etc.

A big part of the solution is around mobile POS and taking legacy POS systems and transforming them into multi-threaded, web-based API services.  This means ripping the UI off of the system and reforming the non-thread-safe portions of the POS system. While these POS systems themselves are quite old, the technology we use to modernize them is not.  We use Aspect Oriented Programming along with dependency injection frameworks and the Spark Java microservices framework to make the old new.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive the development and testing of latest Mad Mobile Payments Technology Products and Services solutions
  • Coordinates activities and tasks among project team members, other internal departments and client as needed to meet project goals and ensure project completion is on schedule, within budget constraints and of the appropriate quality standards for the project scope
  • Manages project risks, issues/problems and activity progress to ensure project goals, e.g., deadline, scope and quality are achieved

 

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of technology management experience
  • 3 + years of experience in leading software development projects, ideally in the area of Payments Technology to include payment devices and gateways
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities, limited resources and tight deadlines; excellent leadership, delegation and organizational skills to plan, prioritize, and handle multiple projects simultaneously
  • Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity; think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges
  • Ability to set clear expectations, manage team performance, and build high morale among team members
  • Strong customer and team orientation.

description:
Mad Mobile helps companies reimagine how they connect with customers. Our unique platform enables restaurants retailers and grocers to achieve mobility with their existing systems to increase sales and digitize the guest experience.  

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer of Mad Mobile, you will work with talented colleagues and partners such as Apple, Salesforce and others build the next generation of retail tech. You will work with some of the world’s largest brands and most iconic brands to drive an enhanced consumer experience and bottom-line for our customers. As the EVP and GM for our Retail line of business, you will be fully accountable for the success of the retail portfolio during an explosive period of growth at Mad Mobile. 

 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Full P&L responsibility accountable to the executive leadership team and board of directors 

  • Plan and execute the go to market strategy and solution roadmap for the Mad Mobile Retail Line of Business 

  • Drive continuous improvement through best practices and capitalize on key market opportunities, ensuring that resources are wisely leveraged to maximize shareholder return 

  • Recruit, develop and grow key leaders in the organization to drive business outcomes and improve team performance 

  • Cultivate innovative industry leading solutions that further emphasize Mad Mobile’s leadership position in the market of mobile first solutions for retail customers 

  • Establish and maintain strong relationships and partnerships in the industry 

  • Work across the Mad Mobile echo system to deliver innovative customer focused solutions 

Skills and Qualifications 

  • Experience as an executive level business operator with P&L ownership and proven ability to grow a software-oriented business unit 

  • Proven ability to develop and maintain financial plans 

  • Strong decision-making capabilities 

  • Ability to motivate and lead people, and hold employees accountable for their outcomes 

  • Proven track-record of managing a team and developing talent within an organization 

Preferred Qualifications 

  • Master’s degree in business management  

  • VP or C Level Executive with retail software experience

  • Strong retail industry connections  

  • History of driving innovation in retail consumer experience through software

Foundational Competencies 

  • Situational adaptability – adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations. 

  • Resilience – rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations 

  • Collaboration – building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives 

  • Self-awareness – using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses 

  • Decision Making – making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward 

EEOC Statement 

Mad Mobile is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.
